title: BBC.Tiger.Spy.in.the.Jungle.1of3.2008.PDTV.XviD.MP3.Remax.avi
description:
Wildlife documentary.

David Attenborough narrates the lives of four growing tiger cubs using footage collected by hidden-camera-carrying elephants. The half-grown cubs are learning the hunting and fighting skills they&#039;ll need as adults. The cameras also give an insight into the worlds of other animals, with leopards presenting a real threat to the growing cubs, and deer making good hunting practice. The tigers head to a water hole to cool off on a steaming hot day, and the spy-cams show that the jungle pools are a magnet for a whole array of forest animals, including wild boars and sloth bears. But disaster strikes when both the cubs&#039; parents are injured and a rogue male puts in an appearance.
